title: Mahabharata | Part 45 | Danger befalls Sairindhri | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa.
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Om Ajahnath Mirandasya Dhyananjana Chalakaya Chaksharanme Litam Jena Dasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, offering obeisances to the spiritual master and Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So, in case of any danger and in case of need of any help, they decided on code names by which they would call each other.
segments.summary: The speaker summarizes the previous episode, detailing the Pandavas' decision to go incognito in the kingdom of Virata, their chosen disguises, and the secret code names they established for emergencies.

segments.key_quote: Although Keechaka was a disturbance, he was also a great protective shield for Virata's kingdom.
segments.summary: The lecture describes Duryodhana's efforts to uncover the Pandavas' disguise and introduces Keechaka, the powerful commander-in-chief of Virata's army, highlighting his influence and the kingdom's dependence on him.

segments.key_quote: Actually, you should be in a much better condition than this. Why don't you become my queen?
segments.summary: Keechaka sees Draupadi (Sairindri) and becomes infatuated with her, proposing to her and being rebuffed. He then enlists his sister Sudeshna's help to woo her.

segments.key_quote: Oh, my dear lady, you have already seen that day, how he was talking to me. And he has these kind of lusty desires to me.
segments.summary: Sudeshna, despite Draupadi's objections, sends her to Keechaka's chambers. Draupadi prays to Suryadeva for protection as she goes.

segments.key_quote: If you want to love me, first learn to love my dog.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the relationship between the Devatas and Vishnu, emphasizing that devotion to Vishnu extends to his devotees. Suryadeva, recognizing Draupadi's devotion to Krishna, sends a Rakshasa to protect her.

segments.key_quote: Oh! My Sairendri, my dear lady, you have come.
segments.summary: Keechaka attempts to assault Draupadi in his chambers. She escapes and runs into the royal assembly, where Keechaka drags her by the hair and kicks her. The Rakshasa intervenes, attacking Keechaka.

segments.key_quote: A woman's honour is being violated. That too, right in front of you in your assembly.
segments.summary: Draupadi pleads for justice in the assembly, criticizing the inaction of King Virata and indirectly appealing to Yudhishthira and Bhima. Bhima is enraged but restrained by Yudhishthira to protect their disguise.

segments.key_quote: This is neither the time, nor the opportunity, nor the place for you to, to air your grievances.
segments.summary: King Virata hesitates to act against Keechaka. Yudhishthira intervenes, advising Draupadi to leave. Draupadi complies, and Keechaka storms out of the room.
Sudeshna expresses anger at Keechaka's actions. Draupadi, fearing further attacks, contemplates a plan to escape his clutches, setting the stage for the next episode.
